evidence: That’s why we don’t pinpoint a single location, but instead assign a probability distribution-centered closer to one detector or the other, depending on the measured delay.
coincidence detection gives us the line
time-of-flight narrows it down to a region on that line where the paired emission happened
modern PET scanners increasingly use time-of-flight technology-it significantly improves image quality without requiring extra radiation dose

concepts.term: by measuring this tiny arrival time difference, we can estimate where along the line the event occurred

evidence: there is still some uncertainty. That's why we don't pinpoint a single location, but instead assign a probability distribution-centered closer to one detector or the other, depending on the measured delay.
